intro: Antidesma membranaceum, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are edible. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
